column4: How can you bind bash to run a command when you type it in (E.g. typing "bar" would run /home/foo/bar.sh)?
you can use an alias. or you can name bar.sh bar and put it sonewhere in your path
as llutz ~/bin/ will be added to PATH if you create it ...
it will work only for you. i.e. the command will only be aviable to you
